queries.description: Non boolean conditions can be confusing for developers.
queries.name: The condition of an if-statement shall have type bool

queries.description: Non boolean conditions can be confusing for developers.
queries.name: The condition of an iteration statement shall have type bool

A5-0-2.title: The condition of an if-statement and the condition of an iteration statement shall have type bool.

queries.description: A switch statement constructed with less than two case-clauses can be expressed as an if statement more naturally.
queries.name: A switch statement shall have at least two case-clauses, distinct from the default label

A6-4-1.title: A switch statement shall have at least two case-clauses, distinct from the default label.

queries.description: If the body of a switch is not enclosed in braces, then this can lead to incorrect execution, and hard for developers to maintain.
queries.name: The statement forming the body of a switch shall be a compound statement

queries.description: If the body of a loop is not enclosed in braces, then this can lead to incorrect execution, and hard for developers to maintain.
queries.name: The statement forming the body of a loop shall be a compound statement

M6-3-1.title: The statement forming the body of a switch, while, do ... while or for statement shall be a compound statement.

queries.description: If the body of an if statement is not enclosed within brackets then this can lead to incorrect execution and is hard for developers to maintain.
queries.name: An if ( condition ) construct shall be followed by a compound statement

M6-4-1.title: An if ( condition ) construct shall be followed by a compound statement. The else keyword shall be followed by either a compound statement, or another if statement.

queries.description: The final else statement is a defensive programming technique.
queries.name: All if ... else if constructs shall be terminated with an else clause

M6-4-2.title: All if ... else if constructs shall be terminated with an else clause.

queries.description: By default, in C++ the switch statement syntax is weak which may lead to unspecified behaviour.
queries.name: A well formed switch statement must start with a case clause

queries.description: By default, in C++ the switch statement syntax is weak which may lead to unspecified behaviour.
queries.name: A well formed switch statement should only have expression, compound, selection, iteration or try statements within its body

M6-4-3.title: A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement.

queries.description: Nested switch labels cause undefined behaviour.
queries.name: A switch-label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement

M6-4-4.title: A switch-label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement.

queries.description: If a non empty switch clause does not have a throw/break statement, it will by default fall into the next switch clause. This can lead to unspecified behaviour. A switch clause shall always have a throw or break.
queries.name: An unconditional throw or break statement shall terminate every non-empty switch-clause

M6-4-5.title: An unconditional throw or break statement shall terminate every non-empty switch-clause.

queries.description: This is a defensive programming technique. The exception to this is if the condition of the switch statement is of type enum and all of the enum values are included in case labels.
queries.name: Missing default-clause in switch

queries.description: This is a defensive programming technique.
queries.name: The final clause of a switch statement shall be the default-clause

M6-4-6.title: The final clause of a switch statement shall be the default-clause.

queries.description: An if statement is more appropriate for bool type.
queries.name: The condition of a switch statement shall not have bool type

M6-4-7.title: The condition of a switch statement shall not have bool type.

queries.description: Unconstrained use of goto can lead to unspecified behaviour.
queries.name: Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement

M6-6-1.title: Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement.

queries.description: Jumping back to an earlier section in the code can lead to accidental iterations.
queries.name: The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function body

M6-6-2.title: The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function body.

queries.description: The continue statement can cause unnecessary complexity.
queries.name: The continue statement shall only be used within a well-formed for loop

M6-6-3.title: The continue statement shall only be used within a well-formed for loop.
